content: right wrap your yarn around schematic 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 a arm 14 cm / 15 cm / 16 25 cm / 17 25 cm / 18 25 cm / 19 5 cm / 20 5 cm / 21 5 cm / circumference 5 1/ 6 6 1/ 6 3/ 7 1/ 7 3/ 8 8 1/ 2 2 4 8 4 2 5 cm / 5 cm / 5 cm / 5 cm / 5 cm / 5 cm / 5 cm / 5 cm / b arm length 2 2 2 2 2 2 2 2 8 5 cm / 8 5 cm / 8 5 cm / 8 5 cm / 8 5 cm / 10 cm / 10 cm / 10 cm / c thumb gusset depth 3 1/ 3 1/ 3 1/ 3 1/ 4 4 4 4 4 4 4 4 d circumference at widest 19 cm / 20 25 cm / 21 25 cm / 22 5 cm / 24 5 cm / 25 75 cm / 26 75 cm / 27 75 cm / part of the hand 7 1/ 8 8 1/ 9 9 3/ 10 10 1/ 11 2 4 4 2 14 cm / 15 cm / 16 25 cm / 17 25 cm / 18 25 cm / 19 5 cm / 20 5 cm / 21 5 cm / e knuckle circumference 5 1/ 6 6 1/ 6 3/ 7 1/ 7 3/ 8 8 1/ 2 2 4 8 4 2 2 5 cm / 2 5 cm / 2 5 cm / 2 5 cm / 2 5 cm / 2 5 cm / 2 5 cm / 2 5 cm / f cuff depth 2x2 rib 1 1 1 1 1 1 1 1 0 75 cm / 0 75 cm / 0 75 cm / 0 75 cm / 0 75 cm / 0 75 cm / 0 75 cm / 0 75 cm / f cuff depth rolled hem 1/ 1/ 1/ 1/ 1/ 1/ 1/ 1/ 4 4 4 4 4 4 4 4 legend and a note on reading charts m c throughout this pattern the charts are read from the bottom to the top and from the right to the left c c sections outlined in red are the pattern repeat to work a round begin by working the stitches to the right of the outlined repeat next work the pattern repeat you will do this until the number of stitches remaining in the round is the same as the number of stitches shown to the left of the outlined pattern repeat in the chart for this pattern that is always one stitch you will always work a full pattern repeat never a partial repeat work the final stitch as shown in the chart 4 @thestitchling cuff note you may find the introduction to magic loop german twisted cast on and setting up your magic
